definition: Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: Are you seriously suggesting she did this on purpose?
sentences.chinese: 说正经的，你的意思是她故意这样做的？

sentences.english: He thinks, media acclaims this matter intentionally.
sentences.chinese: 他认为，有媒体故意炒作此事。

sentences.english: We use it to describe someone who confuses right and wrong deliberately.
sentences.chinese: 我们用它来形容那些故意颠倒是非的人。

sentences.english: That perverse guy has been nagging at me all day.
sentences.chinese: 那个故意与我作对的家伙让我终日不得安宁。

sentences.english: At his instigation , the water carriers deliberately delayed their delivery by two days.
sentences.chinese: 在他的鼓动下，他们故意比规定的日期迟了两天献水。

sentences.english: Criminal penalties are often imposed for acts referred to as willful or knowing violations.
sentences.chinese: 刑事处罚常常用来约束那些涉及到故意犯罪行为。

sentences.english: Especially subjectivity should be to compose important condition with deliberately or significant fault intentionally.
sentences.chinese: 尤其是主观故意，应以故意或重大过失为构成要件。

sentences.english: Especially subjectivity should be to compose important condition with deliberately or significant fault intentionally.
sentences.chinese: 尤其是主观故意，应以故意或重大过失为构成要件。

sentences.english: While the subjective one is mainly around the intentional crime and the transform of crime intention.
sentences.chinese: 主观特征主要围绕犯罪故意及犯意转化而展开。

sentences.english: Do you remember the time I flirted with all
sentences.chinese: 我故意跟众人打情骂俏。

sentences.english: The manner of folding a letter, for example, may embody a studied affront.
sentences.chinese: 比如信纸的折法，稍有不慎，就会被当做故意冒犯。

sentences.english: Yet pretending you have never been in my heart.
sentences.chinese: 却还得故意装作丝毫没把你放在心里。

sentences.english: At present, the suspicion of intentional homicide, Chen has been approved by the prosecution to arrest.
sentences.chinese: 目前，因涉嫌故意杀人罪，陈某已被检方批准逮捕。

definition: inadvertent/accidental/to have no intention of (doing sth)
to play dirty tricks/to be up to mischief
to compile/to draw up/to fabricate/to invent/to concoct/to make up/to cook up
to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
